Class Filter<T extends Record>

  • java.lang.Object
    • seng202.group6.model.Filter<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AirlineFilter, AirportFilter, FlightFilter, RouteFilter

    public abstract class Filter<T extends Record>
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract Filter Class for Records.

      • matches

        public abstract boolean matches(T t)
        Compares the given Record to the filter's criteria.
        Parameters:
        t - the record to check
        Returns:
        true if the record matches all defined criteria, else false.

      • stringMatches

        public static boolean stringMatches(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> filter,
                                    java.lang.String value)
        Checks if the passed string matches any in the given set. The strings in the set must all be lower case. If the set of strings is empty accept all strings.
        Parameters:
        filter - the set of strings to accept
        value - the string being tested
        Returns:
        true if the string matches any in the given set, else false

      • stringMatches

        public static boolean stringMatches(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> filter,
                                    java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> values)
        Checks if any of the given strings match any of the given strings. The given strings must all be lower case. If the filter set of strings is empty accept all strings.
        Parameters:
        filter - the set of strings to accept
        values - the strings to test for acceptance
        Returns:
        true if at least one of the given strings matches, else false

      • inRange

        public static boolean inRange(java.lang.Double[] range,
                              double value)
        Checks the given value is inside the given range. A null value in the range specifies that it is unbounded in that direction.
        Parameters:
        range - the (inclusive) ranmesge of values to accept
        value - the value to check
        Returns:
        true if the value is in the range, else false

      • inRange

        public static boolean inRange(java.lang.Integer[] range,
                              int value)
        Checks the given value is inside the given range. A null value in the range specifies that it is unbounded in that direction.
        Parameters:
        range - the (inclusive) range of values to accept
        value - value to check
        Returns:
        true if the value in the range, else false

      • booleanMatches

        public static boolean booleanMatches(java.lang.Boolean filter,
                                     boolean testee)
        Check that the two booleans match. If the Boolean to test against is null, accept both true and false.
        Parameters:
        filter - boolean to test against
        testee - boolean being tested
        Returns:
        true if booleans match, else false

      • rangeIsValid

        public static boolean rangeIsValid(java.lang.Integer[] range)
        Verify that the array is a valid range, that is, that it has two elements and if neither are null the first is not greater than the second.
        Parameters:
        range - the array to check
        Returns:
        true if the array is a valid range, else false
